alert.note: Alert for Inland Collier County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 3:29PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Collier County through 400 PM EDT... At 329 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a funnel cloud near Copeland, or 13 miles north of Everglades City, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds, winds in excess of 30 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fakahatchee Strand State Preserve, Picayune Strand State Forest, South Blocks Golde, Jerome and Deep Lake. FUNNEL CLOUD...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes.
